snippet: The highest rates are among black children with disabilities, which can include learning difficulties.
abstract: Education Department data finds 13 percent of disabled students in kindergarten through 12th grade were suspended during the 2009-10 school year, compared with 7 percent of students without disabilities; highest rates are among black children with disabilities, which can include learning difficulties.
lead_paragraph: The highest rates are among black children with disabilities, which can include learning difficulties.

headline.main: Suspensions Are Higher for Disabled Students, Federal Data Indicate
headline.print_headline: Suspensions Are Higher For Disabled Students, Federal Data Indicate
